name: The Galactic Series
description: In an effort to unite the galaxy, Quark is reviving the classic human pastime of baseball. However, his true motives may have the opposite effect. Oversee the Galactic Series and prevent Quark's games from devolving into an intergalactic incident.
rules:
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Faction Missions and Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Quark, Garland, Rom, Dax, or crew with the Athlete trait will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Quark, Garland, Rom, Dax or crew with the Athlete trait
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Rom
featured_crew.flavor: Rom joined Sisko's baseball team, pinch hitting for the Niners against the Vulcan Logicians.

adventures.description: Show players footage from classic games.

adventures.description: Catch foul balls from every player in the series.

rewards.name: The Galactic Series
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

goals.flavor: Defy or enforce the rules with help from your allies.

rewards.name: Rom
rewards.flavor: Rom joined Sisko's baseball team, pinch hitting for the Niners against the Vulcan Logicians.

rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "You know, I have to say, I have a certain...appreciation for you primitive humans. There's a certain straightforwardness and chaos to you all. I like that in a mark...I mean, uh, a human. Much better than the slippery know-it-all facade of the humans from my time."

"Thank you... I think. I agree with you on one thing, though--getting on with humans from what you all call the present era is more challenging than I expected. The ability to travel through space is amazing enough, but the very core of human interaction has changed."

"Yes, yes, technology does much more than just fatten the proverbial wallet. Not that that's a bad thing. Still, maybe it's time to reintroduce a classic human pastime. I think this "baseball" you humans enjoy might be the perfect bridge between generations and species."
"How nice, Captain. Using a human pastime to 'unite the galaxy.' It truly is a lovely idea. Of course, coming from Quark, I would think it normal to have some misgivings regarding his motives."

"I've followed Quark's example and done research of my own. Are you familiar with the 'Black Sox Scandal of 1919,' Captain? To think, athletes who prided themselves on skill would lose on purpose. It would certainly be a shame if history were to repeat itself, don't you think?"

responses.text: "Do you really believe any of these teams would throw away their pride for Quark?"
"No match fought for financial gain can be an honorable one."

screens.text: "Money talks, Captain, and everyone has their price. I expect that even the Klingons, in spite of their stubborn obsession with 'honor,' could be bought for the right price."
"Indeed. Though I suppose it will take some work on your part to prove what he's up to."
"Agreed. But I'll leave it to you to deal with, Captain, since you folks at Starfleet love to play galactic referees anyway."
"Do what you want, I just thought I should address it with you before an intergalactic incident breaks out. I get a cut of Quark's revenue either way."
